description: Known as 'the town of the beginning and the end', Loguetown is the birthplace and execution site of the former Pirate King, Gol D. Roger. It lies near Reverse Mountain and the Red Line, making it a strategic stop for pirates entering the Grand Line from the East Blue.

keyEvents.title: Introduction to Loguetown
keyEvents.description: Loguetown is introduced as the crew's next destination before entering the Grand Line.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Loguetown as a symbolic threshold between the East Blue and the Grand Line.

keyEvents.title: Gold Roger's Execution Platform Mentioned
keyEvents.description: The execution platform where Gold Roger was killed is mentioned as a significant landmark in Loguetown.
keyEvents.significance: Reinforces the historical importance of Loguetown in the One Piece world.

geography: A town located near Reverse Mountain and the Red Line in the East Blue. It serves as the last major stop for ships entering the Grand Line.
culture: Loguetown holds immense significance in pirate culture as the place where the Great Pirate Era began with Gold Roger's execution and final words.

description: The execution platform in Loguetown where Gol D. Roger, the Pirate King, was executed. His final words from this platform sparked the Great Pirate Era.

keyEvents.title: Execution Platform Mentioned
keyEvents.description: The platform is mentioned as the historic site where Gold Roger's execution sparked the Great Pirate Era.
keyEvents.significance: This landmark symbolizes both the end of Roger's life and the beginning of a new era of piracy.

geography: Located in the center of Loguetown.
culture: A pilgrimage site for many pirates who want to see where the Pirate King met his end and began a new era.

name.japanese: ゴーイング・メリー号

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' first ship, a caravel gifted to them by Kaya. It serves as their home and transportation.

keyEvents.title: News Coo Delivers Bounty Poster
keyEvents.description: A News Coo arrives at the Going Merry with Luffy's first bounty poster.
keyEvents.significance: The crew learns about Luffy's bounty while aboard their ship.

keyEvents.title: Crew Domestic Moments
keyEvents.description: Various comedic domestic moments occur aboard the Going Merry as the crew interacts.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the crew's daily life and relationships aboard their ship.

geography: Currently sailing from Arlong Park toward Loguetown in the East Blue.
culture: The Going Merry serves as the Straw Hat Pirates' home and base of operations.

description: The main headquarters of the Marines, where high-ranking officers coordinate operations and make strategic decisions about pirate threats.

keyEvents.title: Luffy's Bounty Announced at Marine HQ
keyEvents.description: Lieutenant Commander Brannew announces Luffy's first bounty of 30 million berries at Marine Headquarters.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the Marines officially recognizing Luffy as a significant threat.

culture: The central command center for Marine operations worldwide.

description: A small peaceful village in the East Blue where Luffy grew up. It's also where Luffy met Shanks and received his straw hat.

keyEvents.title: Foosha Village Celebrates
keyEvents.description: The villagers celebrate when they learn about Luffy's first bounty, proud that he's pursuing his dream.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the continued support from Luffy's hometown despite his criminal status.

geography: A coastal village in the East Blue.
culture: A simple, peaceful village where Luffy spent his childhood.
